mdx.rawBody:
---
status: draft
shortDescription: "Tail-recursive call sites of non-void methods need no return statement"
shortCorrection: "In non-void methods, even tail-recursive call sites need a return statement"
concepts:
  - Recursion
  - Call
related:
# - id: LiteralNoExpression
#   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
# - pl: JavaScript
#   id: RecursiveCallSiteNoReturn
# - pl: Python
#   id: RecursiveCallSiteNoReturn
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["8.4.5", "14.17"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14
expressibleInNms:
  - id: ControlFlowAsGraph
    how: graph of a tail-recursive method
---

The recursive case in a recursive method does not need any return statement, even if the recursive method has a non-void return type. A return statement in a base case of recursive methods unwinds the entire recursion.

frontmatter.shortDescription: Tail-recursive call sites of non-void methods need no return statement
frontmatter.shortCorrection: In non-void methods, even tail-recursive call sites need a return statement
